a.title: NEAAAT Students Present to the Charter School Advisory Board NEAAAT students Alexandra Pitchford, Abbigail Barry, Gabrielle Hoskins and Tevin Walton presented along with CEO Dr. Andrew Harris, Chairman of the Board of Directors Dr. Joseph Peele and Executive Director of STEM Dr. Tonya M. Little at the Charter School Advisory Board meeting. The students shared their experiences with FLL and engaged the board representatives in an EV3 Robotics demonstration. Way to go, Griffins!

li.a: NEAAAT Students Present to the Charter School Advisory Board NEAAAT students Alexandra Pitchford, Abbigail Barry, Gabrielle Hoskins and Tevin Walton presented along with CEO Dr. Andrew Harris, Chairman of the Board of Directors Dr. Joseph Peele and Executive Director of STEM Dr. Tonya M. Little at the Charter School Advisory Board meeting. The students shared their experiences with FLL and engaged the board representatives in an EV3 Robotics demonstration. Way to go, Griffins!

em.strong: Click here for the latest information on High School Remote Learning Protocol.

p.span: Admission to the Northeast Academy for Aerospace and Advanced Technologies (NEAAAT) will be determined by a lottery held on May 9, 2020. Applications must be mailed and postmarked, emailed, or submitted through the Lotterease online application system between January 1, 2020 and April 30, 2020 to be entered into the lottery.

div.p: NEAAAT is a highly innovative regional public school that inspires and prepares all students with the STEM-related skills, knowledge, and attitudes needed to meet future challenges in the global workforce and their communities.

aside.div: NEAAAT will be a model for teaching and learning and a leader in the movement to ensure that all children have equitable access to a high quality education.

div.p:
Northeast Academy for Aerospace and Advanced Technologies (NEAAAT)
ECSU ITC, 1810 Weeksville Rd
PO Box 2889
Elizabeth City, NC 27909
Please direct all inquires to info@northeastacademy.org.
